results.title: Adjusting and checking expansion valve
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Design and operation of the bellows type and the diaphragm type automatic expansion valves, and how to adjust, check and service the bellows type valve.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Design and operation of the bellows type and the diaphragm type automatic expansion valves, and how to adjust, check and service the bellows type valve.
description_for_label:
Episode number 7 of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Design and operation of the bellows type and the diaphragm type automatic expansion valves, and how to adjust, check and service the bellows type valve.

results.title: Adjusting and repairing the thermo expansion valve
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and Anson Bond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Explains the theory of multiple commercial refrigeration systems, how to test and adjust the thermo-expansion valve, recognize symptoms of trouble with the valve and repair it.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Frederick K Rockett and Anson Bond Productions

results.title: Removing or installing a compressor or condenser
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Common cooling unit disorders in a domestic refrigerator; how to evacuate valved evaporators; remove an oil-logged evaporator; install the evaporator; and install a direct expansion cooling unit.

results.title: Checking the system. Pt. II: trouble shooting
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates how to install a gauge manifold in a domestic refrigerator; how to check abnormal head pressure and abnormal back pressure; how to determine causes of several common troubles such as “unit will not run”, “no refrigeration, but the unit runs continuously”, and “improper refrigeration of food but the unit freezes ice cubes”. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.
results.title_for_label: Checking the system. Pt. II: trouble shooting
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates how to install a gauge manifold in a domestic refrigerator; how to check abnormal head pressure and abnormal back pressure; how to determine causes of several common troubles such as “unit will not run”, “no refrigeration, but the unit runs continuously”, and “improper refrigeration of food but the unit freezes ice cubes”. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates how to install a gauge manifold in a domestic refrigerator; how to check abnormal head pressure and abnormal back pressure; how to determine causes of several common troubles such as “unit will not run”, “no refrigeration, but the unit runs continuously”, and “improper refrigeration of food but the unit freezes ice cubes”. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.

results.title: Checking the system. Pt. I: general procedure
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates how to install gauges in a domestic refrigerator; check operating pressure, compressor performance, and temperature range of the cooling unit; and clean the condenser and oil the motor of an open-type refrigeration unit. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.
results.title_for_label: Checking the system. Pt. I: general procedure
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates how to install gauges in a domestic refrigerator; check operating pressure, compressor performance, and temperature range of the cooling unit; and clean the condenser and oil the motor of an open-type refrigeration unit. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates how to install gauges in a domestic refrigerator; check operating pressure, compressor performance, and temperature range of the cooling unit; and clean the condenser and oil the motor of an open-type refrigeration unit. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.

results.title: Checking and replacing a float valve
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
This film demonstrates the function of two basic types of float valves - high-side float and low-side float; how to correct troubles in both types; and replace a high-side float. Part of the Refrigeration Service series of 9 films.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education
results.description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.

results.title: Adjusting pressure actuated temperature control devices
results.creator_credit: Frederick K Rockett and Anson Bond Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Explains the purpose of pressure actuated temperature control devices; how to adjust the pressure actuated motor control and how to adjust the metering type and snap-action two-temperature valves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frederick K Rockett and Anson Bond Productions
results.description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
Explains the purpose of pressure actuated temperature control devices; how to adjust the pressure actuated motor control and how to adjust the metering type and snap-action two-temperature valves.

results.title: Adding or removing refrigerent
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
A refrigeration training film providing instruction on checking a domestic refrigeration system for lack of refrigerant, adding refrigerant for leak testing, how to add refrigerant by weight, adding an unmeasured amount and how to remove a refrigerant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Frederick K Rockett and United States. Office of Education. Division of Visual Aids
results.description:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
A refrigeration training film providing instruction on checking a domestic refrigeration system for lack of refrigerant, adding refrigerant for leak testing, how to add refrigerant by weight, adding an unmeasured amount and how to remove a refrigerant.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Refrigeration Service”.
A refrigeration training film providing instruction on checking a domestic refrigeration system for lack of refrigerant, adding refrigerant for leak testing, how to add refrigerant by weight, adding an unmeasured amount and how to remove a refrigerant.
